intro: Leucas ebracteata, commonly known as the white leucas, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale purple flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Leucas ebracteata is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in full sun.
